boardgame.name: Power Armor
boardgame.description:
For use with the Spaceship Architect roleplaying game. Power Armor cards expand your characters power level by offering a dynamic arm cannon system, missile launchers, and several suit upgrades. Perfect for "Metroidvania" inspired science fiction campaigns!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: AdvenTourist
boardgame.description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like entertainment, gastronomy) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Shaintar Adventure Cards
boardgame.description:
Add these Shaintar-specific Adventure Cards to your existing Savage Worlds Adventure Deck to seriously ramp up the Epic High Fantasy aspects of your game. 6 pages with 27 new cards that bring that special Shaintar flair to your game table, cranking everything up to the action fantasy adventure cinema experience that defines this setting.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Second Edition Spell Cards: Class Focus Spells
boardgame.description:
An Awesome Accessory for six PF2 classes!

The Class Focus Spells set includes spell cards for six Pathfinder Second Edition classes, including bards, champions, druids, monks, sorcerers, and wizards, from allegro to warped terrain, with complete rules for every spell. Spells are placed one to a card, save a handful of highly complex spells spread over 2-3 cards. Print the cards you need or order a set of printed cards, perfect to use with your own deck boxes or card sheets!

Second Edition Spell Cards bring you a killer collection of handy spell resources that makes life easy on you as the player. Just pull the cards you're preparing for that day and you're always ready for action! Check out the companion Basic sets for each spellcasting tradition, as well as the Master sets with all higher-level spells, plus additional sets for Domain Spells, Devotee Spells, and Class Focus spells! If you're playing Pathfinder Second Edition, this 89-card deck will definitely help Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

Bring home this amazing adventure add on and make your next family game night Legendary!

boardgame.description:

The Feast of Flavor Premium Cards are a handy accessory for this Legendary Beginnings adventure featuring 100 cards.

These enhanced premium cards feature full artwork on each card and include all four decks used in the Legendary Beginnings "A Feast of Flavor" adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fake Gnus: A Ridiculous Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From DriveThruRPG:

You are an ambitious wildebeest entering the cut-throat worlds of business and politics.

This is a ridiculous one-page roleplaying game, designed to promote hijinks and shenanigans through poltical satire and parody.

The rules are simple but the stakes are high. Succeed and you’ll win bigly. Fail and... well, there’s always fake gnus!

boardgame.name: Fake Play
boardgame.description:
From DriveThruRPG:

You meet in a tavern … it’s where your Heroes’ story continues, the resemblance with your “vanilla” adventure ends and the beginning is hidden in the shadows.

Fake Play is a rural mystery adventure with a few cinematic elements. It is designed to be completed in a single session by three to six Characters in their Basic Tier.

While the characters investigate the location for clues in order to solve the mystery, they get the chance to save a potential ally from immediate danger. They discover the victim and the apparent culprit of a crime scene. Perchance, they even have to handle an assault.

boardgame.name: Fakers & Freebooters
boardgame.description:
From DriveThruRPG:

Space piracy — a plague on interstellar society! A scourge nearly impossible to eradicate!

The line between pirates, privateers, opportunistic adventurers, and space captains confiscating resources for themselves is blurry. Common to them all, however, is their preying upon freight, infrastructure, and commerce, and their willful looting of space depots, scientific installations, and astro-settlements.

Some space pirates rely on stealth to hit-and-run, others on strength to discourage resistance and retaliation, and yet others on greasing corrupt palms. The most successful, however, employ all these strategies and more.

Fakers & Freebooters is a 24-page bonus drama, in which the troupe finds itself on the world of Hargard, investigating the murder of Bishop Benedict in the backwater bishopric of Ruthwyck.

boardgame.name: Fake Encounters on the Strange Type
boardgame.description:
From DriveThruRPG:

Nice little game, acting out stories of alien encounters.

Whoever tells it best wins.
boardgame.rpg: Fake Encounters on the Strange Type

boardgame.name: A Strange Light Breaks
boardgame.description:
'FRPGD Blurb'

Explore the even stranger side of Iron Kingdoms: Requiem in this showcase of the foremost paranormal investigators in the world of Full Metal Fantasy. Confront mischievous grymkin, the restless dead, and more in this short adventure for five 1st-level characters.

From Free RPG Day:

Curse of the Dread Marsh Crew is a ready to roll 5E adventure by Loke Battle Mats. Set in Maps from the Coast of Dread, this adventure includes Battle Maps and cut out tokens for Characters, Adversaries and Terrain.

Also contained within the adventure book are a quick 5E guide, sheets for the pre-generated characters and stat blocks for the foes they will encounter.

boardgame.name: Skitter Warp
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb
When an unprecedented cosmic storm engulfs a world of peaceful scientists, the inhabitants are transformed by planar energies to become either the best or worst versions of themselves. The crew of Nakonechkin Salvage are the only ones close enough to stop an army of demons besieging the capital city, but this mission is personal: one of their own was planetside when the storm hit!

In addition to a rollicking adventure, this book includes four pregenerated characters that are ready to play, with full stat blocks and backstories. The inside front cover includes all the maps needed for this adventure.

Skitter Warp is written for the popular Starfinder Roleplaying Game. It’s intended for 5th-level characters who are ready to lend some helping hands to friends in crisis!

The Duergar’s rituals threaten the kingdoms of the underworld, and the nations of the surface. A party of adventurers must venture into the depths, and fight their way through the legions of the Duergar Cult to try and prevent a terrible demonic force from being called up.

boardgame.name: Level 1 - Volume 3 2022
boardgame.description:
From Free RPG Day:

The INDIE RPG scene is a diverse, fascinating, and vibrant part of the TTRPG community. Once again, 9th Level Games brings a collection of different ideas from the world of INDIE RPGs to FREE RPG DAY 2022.

boardgame.name: Root the RPG: Talon Hill Quickstart
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From FreeRPGDay:

The 2022 Free RPG Day booklet for Root: The Roleplaying Game contains pre-generated characters and a full clearing write up along with all the rules to get you started playing quickly! In Root: The RPG, you and your friends take on the roles of wandering vagabonds—heroes, rogues, and adventurers who have the potential to change the fate of the Woodland—and you’ve recently arrived at Talon Hill! The whole clearing is in the middle of a major succession crisis that could determine the fate of the whole Eyrie Dynasties! Now, the three possible successors are vying to find ancient relics of rulership lost within the crumbling ruins of Augustine Castle…where disintegrating structures might be the least of your worries! Can your vagabonds help keep Talon Hill from boiling over into outright civil war? Which claimant will you support in their pursuit of the throne? Or will you try to find another path entirely, reshaping Talon Hill—and the Eyrie—forever?

boardgame.name: Fröbel Tower
boardgame.description:
"Play: Playing is the highest stage of a child’s development." (Friedrich Fröbel)

This Fröbel Tower is a cooperative game for 2-16 players aged four and over. It is also well suited for adult team building.

The game consists of:

6 beechwood blocks
1 bracket with metal rod
1 plate with 8 holes and 16 cords (each 2 metres long)


For the Fröbel Tower, a large outdoor or indoor play area is necessary.

Object of the game
The construction of the Fröbel Tower is possible only by means of joint, coordinated action. The Fröbel Tower can also be built in a competition between different groups.
The group that can build the highest tower wins the game in this version.

Preparation
Form a circle and place the six beechwood blocks in the middle with the groove facing upwards.

Rules
Each player takes one or more cord ends in his or her hand, depending on the number of participants.
The cords were previously passed through the 8 holes in the plate. Now you tighten the cords and try to hook the bracket into the groove of a wooden block, lift it up carefully and place it gently on another wooden block.
It is important that you hold the cord only at the very end. It must not be shortened by reaching forward.

Together you try to stack the wooden blocks on top of each other until the Fröbel Tower is completed. You have won the game as a team if you manage to use all the wooden blocks and the tower does not fall over during the building work.
When you hook in the bracket, this may cause a wooden block to fall over. Therefore, you should decide before the game starts whether this wooden block can be put back in place or whether it is eliminated from the game.

Game variants

The game is not over until you have dismantled the tower as a team.
You are not allowed to speak during the game. Naturally, this makes building the tower more difficult because you cannot give each other any instructions.
You are only allowed to guide the cord with one hand. This also adds another level of difficulty.
The most difficult way to build the tower is to guide the end of the cord with your "weak" hand. For right-handers it is the left hand, for left-handers the right hand.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Siege Storm: The Rich Goblins Season Zero – Tournament Pack Vol. 1
boardgame.description: This is a set of 10 foil cards (of existing creatures, and new PayToWin cards for the Rich Goblins faction) to be used with the official Tournament Rules for Siegestorm. Retailers have access to these packs and they are given as a reward for playing in the tournament. Players can use these cards in non-tournament play (the 'pay to win' concept) to create a much stronger deck.

boardgame.name: SUWANGO
boardgame.description:
A misterious collector wants to get all the incredible creatures on the planet. She has selected us to complete her collection, taking us to an island of unknown whereabouts where the strangest beings on the planet live.
Became an explorer in a truly beautiful and unique tabletop game experience.

SUWANGO is a highly thematic game where players must fulfill the SUWANGO Code to capture the creatures they have to get to fulfill their secret objective. Beware of the rest of the explorers, they will not hesitate to sabotage your mission to be the first to get the coveted loot.
The first to complete their board will end the game and the one with the most points will win.

boardgame.name: Middara: Aboyama, The Rapturasque Resin Kit
boardgame.description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Rapturasque. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from publisher

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Just like our Cross Promotion Pack, our Resin Lupercalia Kits from last year are now available in plastic. The Lupercalia 2021 Pack includes a plastic set of all seven of the miniatures we made in Resin from our last Kickstarter. This also includes their Item Cards, Combatant Cards, and Adventurer Cards.

Profane Occultists Made Immortal

“Toxie scrubbed the blood from her hands, noting idly that she had nailed the color when choosing her crimson fingernail polish. In the far corner of the abandoned warehouse, a half dozen corpses, all still bound hand and foot, lay in a heap as testament to her night’s labors. Her final victim lay sprawled on the concrete floor behind her, still breathing shallowly through his broken, twisted mouth. She hadn’t actually been planning to pull out his teeth when she started questioning him, but then Luperci and Tixie had radioed in that they cleared the enemy’s hideout, and that Mena was one of the captives they had freed. Threatening the Faun was one thing; dragging an innocent child into it was something else altogether.

Toxie dried her hands gingerly, then turned around to consider her captive. He was definitely dying; even if someone found him now, there weren’t enough surgeons or drugs on Earth to save him. But Toxie had to meet up with her pack to run down the last of the heathens who had escaped with the Faun, and she didn’t like leaving jobs unfinished.

She hunkered down next to him and saw with satisfaction that his eyes were still open, though only just through the swollen wreckage of his face. She blew him a kiss.

“You get a little mercy now,” she crooned as she gently stroked a blood-free patch of skin on his forehead. “I’m late for an orgy, so I can’t really wait around for you to die. You know how it is. . .”
She turned to her gear bag and considered her options. She wanted to use her favorite, but, of course, it had to be the messiest of the lot and she had just finished cleaning up. Eh, what the hell, she thought. Grinning, Toxie grabbed the pink handle and turned back to finish the job.

Outside the warehouse, an early morning train rumbled past, just loud enough to mask the roar of a chainsaw.”

This product contains 7 miniatures, Adventurers, Espers, and new Items.

These new Espers spice your game with unknown variety by adding new Espers that can be summoned by both Adventurers

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Middara: 1.2 Update Pack
boardgame.description:
The 1.2 Update Pack represents Middara: Unintentional Malum in its final form. We’ve been working for years with our community. And together, we honestly feel that we’ve made one of the best dungeon crawl board games ever made. The 1.2 Update Pack represents a culmination of years of labor and the collaboration of hundreds of people.

Just like the first Update Pack (1.1), this product contains every card printed in Middara. That way, you can easily swap your cards out by taking everything in your game and simply replacing it with everything from this box.

Additionally, this product contains all the cards we’ve applied errata to from any Wave 1 products we’ve released thus far. Meaning, Resin Kits, Promotional Content, etc.

We are confident in this version of Middara. It’s our Magnum Opus. While errata happens, we do not expect any fundamental changes to be made to the system at its core. As such, we will be providing an updated Rule Book inside of this product.

As usual, a full print and play for this product is available for free on our website. However, this will be the last time we will be printing this product ourselves and providing it as a physical product.

Includes:
All the cards form all products released priort to 2022.
1.2 Rulebook

—description from the publisher

Middara: Psyche, Aphorism of Love Resin Kit
Middara: Silvia, Dark Mother Cultist Resin Kit
Middara: The Judge's Daughter Resin Kit

boardgame.name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 2+3: Dice Pack
boardgame.description:
This product is for all those backers who already purchased an extra set of dice. Get yourself only what you need and snag an extra set of the dice featured in Act 2 and 3.

Important: This set is only for original backers who already purchased the first half on our Kickstarter campaign and are only got "Extra Dice (Set of 17)". If you’re a new customer, head on over to our “Extra Dice (29 Pack)” for that full-rolling experience.

boardgame.name: Middara: Playmats 2
boardgame.description: 6 custom size (635 x 254mm) neoprene mats featuring vivid Middara character artwork. Keep track of your Stamina Points and your HP in style with our set of playmats. Each one of our six playmats depicts one of our six additional characters and has all the necessary space required to use a full load out of the average character build in Middara!

boardgame.name: Middara: Bag Set 2
boardgame.description:
Already got your swag on with these sweet bags but want the new artwork and option for more characters?

This set contains the six Tuck Bags that you’re missing from your existing set!

Style on your friends, use tuck bags.

Important:This set is only for original BGG customers who already purchased the first half of these tuck bags from Board Game Geek. If you’re a new customer, head on over to our “Tuck Bags (10)” for the full range of artwork.

boardgame.name: Middara: Adventurer Tuckbags
boardgame.description:
These bags were once relegated to the realms of Boardgamegeek. Exclusives that were held out of reach from us mortals. Now, you too can get swagged up with these oversized official Tuck Bags.

This set contains ten Tuck Bags that depict a variety of characters from Unintentional Malum. They’re large size allows you to store your Items, Disciplines, Espers, and Adventurer's between sessions without worry of losing them or destroying them.

Style on your friends, use tuck bags.

boardgame.name: Middara: Playmats Set
boardgame.description:
Keep track of your Stamina Points and your HP in style with our set of playmats.

Each one of our ten playmats depicts one of our main characters and has all the necessary space required to use a full load-out of the average character build in Middara!

This set contains all 10 playmats for Middara!

boardgame.name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – 1.2 Rulebook
boardgame.description: Get yourself a second set of reference material! This 97 page behemoth is a representation of all the tender love and care our wonderful community has for Middara. It’s a reflection of hard work, dedication, and most of all, fun.

boardgame.name: Middara: Act 1 Token Upgrade pack
boardgame.description:
This is half of the stretch goals form the Kickstarter*


Get your game the ultimate miniature upgrade! The Act 1 Token Upgrade Pack turns every cardboard standee in Unintentional Malum: Act 1 into a full fledged miniature.

This monstrosity of a box contains over 30 miniatures that take your Middara experience to the next level.

boardgame.name: CY_BORG
boardgame.description:
Publisher intro

CY_BORG: A Nano-infested doomsday RPG about cybernetic misfits and punks raging against a relentless corporate hell.

User summary
Based on, and mostly compatible with, the Mork Borg dark fantasy game, CY_BORG aims at post-industrial cyberpunk.

boardgame.name: Keydom's Dragons
boardgame.description:
Dragons have plundered the land of Keydom for its treasures, which they are now hoarding in the network of caves around Keytown.

In competition with other players, in Keydom's Dragons you lead a band of eight plucky townsfolk (workers). You will send some of your workers into the caves while the dragons are abroad in order to recover their treasure hoards piece by piece. Other workers will acquire help and assistance in the town, or attempt to find a way past the castle guards using strength or bribes, opening the way for your remaining workers to enter the castle rooms and spend the treasures your team has recovered to buy valuable artefacts.

Once all of the castle's artefacts have been claimed, the player whose band has acquired the most artefacts is victorious, gaining recognition and renown throughout Keydom.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Aeon's End: Legacy of Gravehold – Promos
boardgame.description:
A 32 card pack of Kickstarter exclusive cards received for backing the Legacy of Gravehold Campaign. Included:


Talusoid Clod
Chronophage Coil
Parasitic Force
Ilya’s Trulite Force
Kiel’s Trulite Energy
Qu’s Call of the Void
Thraxir’s Nameless Siphon
Cairna’s Invigorate
Dezmodia’s Eternal Darkness
Ohat’s Shower of Coals
Lucien’s Sun Shard
Reth’s Fossilized Rose
Taqren’s Defense Glyphs
Z’hana’s Scimitar
Arachnos’s Spellbook

boardgame.name: Big Bible Town
boardgame.description: BIG Bible Town is the first and only online game that immerses K-6 children in scripture-based Bible adventures.

boardgame.name: Kernel
boardgame.description:
Kernel is a press-your-luck dice game for small and large groups. Players collect as many kernels as possible all while racing to 100 points. Learn in under 5 minutes. Be smart, quick, and lucky to take home the win. The player that collects the most Kernels wins!

About the game:

Lose or gain kernels depending on your roll.
Be the first to grab the corn cob squeeze when doubles are rolled to earn bonus kernels!
Play it safe or risk it all to earn extra kernels.
Everything you need to play in a convenient canvas storage bag.
Great game for kids to practice addition and risk management skills.
Fun for the whole family and large groups!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Anxia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Courageux citoyen ! La nation d’Anxia fait face à une crise sans précédent. Pour en sortir plus rapidement et plus efficacement, un procédé optimal a été instauré: chaque citoyen se voit assigner un ensemble d’images anonymisées à contrôler. Grâce à cette procédure citoyenne, notre glorieuse nation se redressera, plus forte et plus unie que jamais!

boardgame.name: Cradle of Quartz
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Time is of the essence when the formula for the devastating explosive pyronite falls into the wrong hands. To secure the formula and even the score with the sinister rival who ruined them, a motley gang of outlaws must brave the weird and wild wastes of the Spellscar Desert. At the center of this mutant-filled wasteland, the outlaws discover an abandoned temple of time called the Cradle of Quartz. But while redemption and a fresh start might be nice perks, the outlaws seek something far more valuable among the Cradle's time-warped halls: revenge.

boardgame.name: 42e Méridien Ouest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vous avez plongé dans les tréfonds marins pour rejoindre une cité sous-marine. Trésors, secrets et dangers vous y attendront.

Quelques questions, une liste de détails, une action d'aventure, des créatures et des trésors: cette aventure en une page recto-verso contient tout ce qu'il faut pour une session de jeu de Dungeon World.

Bon jeu!

boardgame.name: Breaking the Luftwaffe
boardgame.description:
Breaking the Luftwaffe is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides three campaigns and 26 scenarios under one cover. The first 9 scenarios follow the beginning of the US 8th Air Force’s escorted strategic bombing campaign over western Germany between October 1943 and January 1944; the next 9 scenarios recreate the intense combat during the “Big Week” air offensive in early 1944; the final 8 scenarios bring together the desperate fighting during Mission 250, the first daylight mission to Berlin. The book also features some of WWII’s top aces including Robert S. Johnson, Gabby Gabreski, “Bud” Anderson, Heinz “Pritzl” Bär, Anton Hackl, and Heinz Knoke. The scenarios can be played individually, linked to form three mini-campaigns, or combined as one grand campaign.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering reintroduces the Commander Draft format originally seen in the first Commander Legends and fuses it with the Dungeons & Dragons theme of Adventures in the Forgotten Realms, using the Forgotten Realms city of Baldur's Gate as the setting.

Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate is designed to be drafted. Each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a commander/background pair, if the commander has the Choose a Background ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck matching the color identity of their commander(s). Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters (individually or in displays of 24), set boosters (individually or in displays of 18), collector boosters (individually or in displays of 12), and bundles, as well as three-pack prerelease kits, which were made available a week in advance of the set's full release. In addition, four 100-card tie-in Commander decks were released alongside the main set.

boardgame.name: Dragonwake
boardgame.description:
Dragonwake is a 3-6 party game of deception, deduction, and dragons!

Undisturbed in the depths of an ancient lair, the Dragon slumbers. If the Dragon wakes, it could be the end of the world as we know it. Legendary heroes have been called to enter the lair, find the sacred relics, and slay the Dragon. But beware! The party of heroes has been infiltrated by the shadowy members of the Dragon Cult. These cultists will lie, deceive, and cheat to sabotage the heroes and wake the Dragon.

Enter the lair with your secret role as a hero or a cultist. Each player is dealt a hand from a deck consisting of relic cards, the dragon card, and gold cards. You can't pick cards from your own hand, so you'll have to lie, build trust, or find other ways to persuade other players to work with you. Find all of the relics in time or before the dragon is found and the heroes win! Otherwise, the cultists wake the Dragon and destroy the world!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description: A Tile laying and Resource management game for 2 to 4 players of mowing over some tough turf. Get your 2 mowers back to the house first to win, but which way you take and what you mow over all depends on you!

boardgame.name: Sushi Skillz
boardgame.description: A small game that came in a "Welcome to the Orient"-themed Battle Bin subscription box. Players gather ingredients to make sushi recipes for points. Game has no box, just a plastic bag.

boardgame.name: Pitch Out 2
boardgame.description:
Pitch Out 2 is a box with new teams (Nomads and Seeds) for the Pitch Out system. The two boxes can be played separately (2 players), or combined (3 and 4 players).

It is a disk-flicking game with tactical elements in which players try to take out or isolate the opponent's leader.

The game is played with a bunch of disks (5-8 for the base sets) and five "walls". In turns, players place their pieces and two walls on their side of the field. Then, they start flicking one disk per turn, trying to push the opponent's disks out of the field.

Each disk has a special power, for example the Assassin just needs to touch an opponent's piece to take it out, so players need to play tactically.

The first player to take out the opponent's leader or all their other pieces wins the game.

boardgame.name: Origins: Ancient Wonders
boardgame.description:
Ancient Wonders is an expansion to Origins: First Builders and consists of two separate modules which can be added to your game separately or together.

Ancient Wonders
This module enables a new type of building that can be added to your city, eight majestic ancient wonders that bring more variability and options to the game.

Trials of the Builders
End-of-round scoring objectives require you to find the right balance between pursuing advancements required by the current round objective versus progressing the personal goals you have set for your civilization already. This module also brings a predetermined length to the game, eliminating all other end game conditions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fancy Feathers
Fasanerie
ファザネリー日本語版
boardgame.description:
In Fancy Feathers, by order of your baroness, you begin to search for noble pheasants for the pheasantry, moving along a path via a simply but really tricky mechanism, collecting valuable cards and avoiding annoying ones. Sadly, you are not alone. Snatch the most beautiful birds to finish the game with the most precious animal collection.

When playing Fancy Feathers, you always choose six of the twelve card types included in the game. Thus, you can play up to 924 different combinations!

Fancy Feathers is also great fun with up to six players. but to play with more than two people, you'll need additional copies of the game to have the required numbers of animal cards and wooden discs.

boardgame.name: Mosómaci Almája
boardgame.description:
The raccoons ran into the city. There, they chat, play at night, and do their best to get their favorite treat, the apple. Housekeepers, on the other hand, don’t really like this night dating; if they can, they confuse the teddy bear.

Make your macid the most skillful! Go ahead and swap the cards to make it harder for the other raccoon!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Bogyó és Babóca Évszakok
boardgame.description:
The four different board games based on the Bogyó and Babóca series are primarily for 3-8 year olds, mainly the preschooler age group.

The simplest type of game is card collecting, the third is a classic step-by-step countdown game that aims to get to the polka dot ladybug house, and the fourth, conversational game requires the help of an adult who reads out questions related to the theme of the seasons.

boardgame.name: Bogyó és Babóca Úton az oviba
boardgame.description:
Who gets to the ovi sooner, where the nanny is waiting for Dongó's kindergarten teacher and Aunt Pettyes Futrinka? It is a long journey through the woods and it hides a lot of games and fun.

Almost all the characters in the fairy tale series are featured in this lovely board game. Swing with a ax lock, pick up peanuts with Squirrel Rego! If you are good at throwing and you are lucky, after a lot of forest adventure you will be the first to go to kindergarten! The easy-to-understand yet exciting game is great fun for little friends of Bogyó és Babóca Tales.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Sherlock: Das Collier
Sherlock: Frida
boardgame.description: The valuable Frida necklace disappears on the night of the Leonardo Awards ceremony. Who stole it, how did it disappear and why? Follow the clues with your team of investigators and try to answer these and many other questions. Will you catch the thief?

boardgame.name: Sherlock: Das Familiengeheimnis
Sherlock: Intrusion
boardgame.description: During a visit to his mother, Josep Vidal suddenly dies. What is the cause of his death? Who is responsible for his death? And why did he die? Follow the clues with your team of investigators and try to answer these and many other questions. Will you fathom Josep's death?

boardgame.name: Sherlock: El fantasma de la habitación 208
Sherlock: Zimmer 208
boardgame.description: For years it seemed gone, but now the ghost of Room 208 at the Blair Hotel has claimed another victim. How did it die? Why? And was it really by magic? Follow the clues with your team of investigators and try to answer these and many other questions. Can you solve this supernatural case?

boardgame.name: John Carter of Mars: Legacy Map of Barsoom
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Legacy Map of Barsoom gives you the tools to make the Red Planet your own. A double sided, full colour A2 map of the beloved world created by Edgar Rice Burroughs shows you all the known locations and cities on Barsoom, with the other side showing the city of Korad. As you play through your adventures and create your version of the world, you’ll no longer forget where you placed your custom city, mysterious structure, ancient ruin or hidden stronghold as you can mark them on the map with the included custom marker stickers. To aid even further in creating you own interesting locations for players to explore is a PDF Travel Guide designed as a resource for narrators filled with further guidance for exploration.

The Legacy Map of Barsoom Includes

Double sided, full colour A2 Map of Barsoom detailing all the prominent locations seen in the RPG and the novels. One side features the map of Baroom, the other the city of Korad.
Custom marker stickers, illustrated to match the existing location markers, with options for various Martian cities, temples, caves, ruins, farms, villages, mysterious structures, and hidden strongholds.
PDF Travel Guide for narrators, featuring information on how to use the map, additional advice on how to run travel heavy games, exploration roll tables to build new locations and their features, as well as a number of pre-written locations and their features described for use in your adventures.

boardgame.name: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your RADISHES!
boardgame.description:
This is the 'superhard' version of "A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different and counting your beetroots." and "AGAQGCTATDACYTurnips."

Players race to grab creatures, but each creature you grab must have a different head (number of eyes), different body (number of arms), and different number of legs.

You can put vegetables in between creatures, but if you grab more than 5 portions, you have been deemed too greedy and lose the game.

In this 'super-hard' edition, the creatures are wearing things, looking away from the 'camera', contorting in weird positions and doing other things that might will add a few seconds of confusion, even for experienced players!

This game is NOT recommended for anyone who hasn't played the earlier editions.

To make it even more visually confusing, most of the vegetable cards have additional items on them. Monocle, sketchbook, or even stuffed toys of the creatures! (But they aren't creatures, they are only stuffed toys of creatures.)

One deck plays up to 3 players. Combine decks to play with more (2 decks for up to 6, 3 decks for up to 9)

There are 2 versions of AGAQGCTATDACYRadishes (coloured in, and line art) for easy mixing and separation.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different, and watching out for turnips.
A game about quickly grabbing creatures that are totally different, and watching out for turnips.

boardgame.name: Mondriaan
boardgame.description:
Mondriaan is a game in which colors and colored areas as well as their number play a very special role.

As simple as monochrome rectangles may be, they can be used in many different ways, which is why totally different game variants await you here.

In one of them, you'll have to keep track of the colors and be quick to react. In the second, on the other hand, it won't hurt if you think a little ahead so that you end up where the most points are.

GAME VARIANT: DICE STUDY

For this variant you need one die and five chips or coins per person. The 12 Mondriaan cards are laid out in the center of the table in a 3x4 grid.

One person rolls a number, while another randomly reveals one of the color cards, if possible at the same time. The two together determine what you need to look for in the cards.

So, if there is a 6 and a red card, you have to look for a card that has six red color squares on it and quickly put one of your chips on it. Whoever succeeds first gets to discard the chip.

Since each combination occurs exactly twice, you can also get rid of two chips per round. If you have no more chips, you win the game.

GAME VARIANT: SPACE COMPOSITION WITH 6 COLORS

For this variant you need two dice and three differently sized game pieces or markers per person, each in one color.

The six color cards are placed face up on the table as a circle. The shuffled Mondriaan cards are distributed evenly to everyone.

Take turns placing one marker on each color card. Never place two markers of the same size on the same card, but place several markers of the same size on the same card.

When both dice are rolled, you take turns performing one of the following actions:
- place a card from your hand on a color card matching the value of a die (if you roll a 6, you can place a card with six red squares on the red color card)

- place one of the upper Mondriaan cards already on the table on another color card, if the conditions there are right.

- place one of your own point markers on another color card

When a person puts down their last card, you calculate your points:
For the color with the most cards on it you get three points, for the next two and then one.
You then multiply these points by the values of your markers, from small to large with one to three.
Whoever has the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Model War Kingdom
boardgame.description:
Long ago, alien beings conquered a world of wild creatures and scattered mystic portals across the land. In time, they left. Now, many millennia later, varied animal kingdoms have arisen -- and learned to use the ancient pathways in their fierce competition!

A skirmish game of cute animals fighting for dominance and survival... and cursing the beautiful land with unwelcome guests.

Player Chose two Creatures from 8 each. And take turn to perform from three Actions for each of their creatures in any order; Move, Attack and place Portals. As well as Upgrading, summoning, casting... in and between Turns.

The Ancients portal's


When you go throught the portals you leave fregment of yourselves in doing so. Fragments that others can pick up on. Fragments from your subconscious mind. And when you gather fragments of others subconscious mind is done so by attaching itself to yours and in the process you can not separate that its yours and that of others since you have no control or awareness. And when it builds up over time its surfaces to the conscious mind as an intuition, a habbit, a memory, as in evolution. You gather them and build on them, develop it, learn it.
It becomes a skill, an ability... a power.

A great Power!

A power that inanimate all other.
A power that can not be stoped and cant stop.
A power that must be destroyed.

boardgame.name: Trekkers
boardgame.description:
Identify pictures of landmarks and sights from different nations shown in the cards while going “trekking.”

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: For What Remains: Terrain and Template Pack Expansion
boardgame.description: This expansion adds 9 new double-sided terrain tiles which allow the player to blend scenery from the 3 games (Streets of Ruin, Blood on the Rails, Out of the Basement) together. Also included are 4 transparent ability templates.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: For What Remains: Blood on the Rails
For What Remains: Out of the Basement
For What Remains: Streets of Ruin

boardgame.name: X MAS M.T. Motoscafi Esplosivi
boardgame.description:
Solitary game on the attacks of the X Flotilla MAS against the Royal Navy bases of Malta and Suda Bay, in Crete.

Parabellum magazine X, Spring 2022

boardgame.name: Dancing Stage EuroMix
boardgame.description: Dancing Stage EuroMIX is the 2nd release in the Dancing Stage series, the European version of Dance Dance Revolution series of music video games by Konami. The arcade version was released in 1999, followed by the Sony PlayStation version in 2001. An updated "Internet Ranking" version of the arcade machine was released later on, containing 6 new tracks.

boardgame.name: Turtle Bay
boardgame.description: Today is the big hatching day: the cute baby turtles in Turtle Bay are finally hatching from their eggs. And of course they want to get into the ocean as fast as possible. But with so much turmoil, the clumsy sea creatures quickly end up on their backs and can no longer move forward without your help. In the beastly good children's game, a lucky hand with the dice is just as important as a little bit of tactical skill.

boardgame.name: Stargrave: The Last Prospector
boardgame.description:
The second supplement for Stargrave offers a host of new scenarios and rules for gaining political backing as you fight across the ravaged galaxy.

The Dahlgren Belt was once a vast asteroid mining operation that supplied the entire sector with rare metals and various elemental fuels. However, the isolation of the last war caused the corporation to wither, and the various outposts and colonies were eventually left to look after themselves. Some became true collectives, or limited democracies, while others have fallen to the rule of gangsters, warlords, and despots. In all cases, the limited resources of air and organic material has made life difficult.

In this supplement for Stargrave, the crews must travel from asteroid-to-asteroid, and even down to the system's single, barely inhabitable planet, searching for a man who claims to have discovered a ‘big score'. During their journey, players will fight through numerous different environments - including asteroid mines, zero gravity, and even hellish jungle. Captains must curry favour with the various small political factions that hold power in the Belt. Only through a combination of wits, diplomacy, and weapons can players hope to reach the last prospector and gain a share of his claim…

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Stargrave: Science Fiction Wargames in the Ravaged Galaxy

boardgame.name: Duskwood
boardgame.description:
Duskwood is a small, quaint village surrounded by a dense forest. Strangers rarely get lost in this remote area and when they do, they always describe the place as weird or even scary. The locals of Duskwood have never been worried about this. However, in the last 72 hours, many things have changed and even among the villagers concerns are growing: A girl has disappeared and the mysterious legends that are surrounding the ancient forest seem to come alive...

There is no trace of the kidnapped girl Hannah Donford. At least not until her friends receive a message from her phone. This message only contains a phone number… your phone number! This strange circumstance brings the group new hope, but what does that mean for you?... Will you respond?

boardgame.name: Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth
boardgame.description:
Heavy Metal meets Fantasy. Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth board game is a huge dungeon-crawling adventure where two teams battle to save the continent of Eragoth.

For 2-4 players in 2 teams. Teams act as the others’ opponents, whilst one team controls the heroic Slayers of Eragoth, the opposing team will control the Demons they encounter until it is time to switch to their own Slayers.

The objective whilst controlling the Slayers is to clear the Overworld and defeat the final boss first, whilst controlling the Demons your aim is to defeat the opposing team’s Slayers.

Replay value and combat is at the heart of Book of Skulls.
During your adventure, you will have access to over 150 unique characters, each with their own movesets.

Set the Overworld using 10 interchangeable modular maps (levels) that each represent a unique region of Eragoth. A different adventure awaits with each game as any number of levels can be selected and placed in any order, allowing you to customise the duration of your game.

Book of Skulls is fully soundtracked with an original Metal soundtrack which perfectly sets the mood for battling the Demons of Eragoth.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Illeria
boardgame.description:
Illeria is a fantasy wargame, in which players control small parties of former prisoners, who fight for survival on the defunct prison island of Illeria. Illeria plays like a cross between a skirmish-style wargame and 3D-chess. Battles are fought on two parallel boards: the harsh Illerian desert of the physical world, and the mystical and surreal badlands of the spirit world. Characters exist in both worlds, and actions in one world often affect the other. For example, characters can spend actions in one world to boost their counterpart, and killing a character in one world greatly harms them in the other.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 頼りない魔法使い (Unreliable Wizard)
boardgame.description:
You are an apprentice wizard tasked by the King with destroying the Demon Lord and thus saving the Princess. This card based solo game has you advancing along the map fighting enemy minions and gathering new magic and traveling companions to assist along the way.

The game consists of 32 cards. you move your wizard along the map and pay Life Points to cross terrain. Certain terrain are battle points where you battle enemy minions. You use your hand of cards to create magic by matching certain magic patterns, your traveling companions may apply skills as well. If you defeat the evil minions you gain more cards which may contain magic or traveling companions. If you defeat the Demon King at the end of the map you win!

boardgame.name: Home Before The Leaves...FALL!
boardgame.description:
This game is based on a paradox. The fact that two armies went to war with modern equipment, and tactics based on experiences of another century. The belief that the bayonet and the massed charge of men and horses was mightier than machine guns and rapid firing field artillery, that stuck in the minds of the Generals and statesmen, even when proved wrong. The beginning of the 1914-1918 saw a "mobile war" of sort, a planned "blitzkrieg" of marching men and railway timetables that broke down. Could it have succeeded? This game cannot give an answer, only a hint.

Game includes 1 tabloid-size map, 3 pgs. of rules, 88 counters (unmounted), and charts. This appears to be a game taken from Combat magazine. Description verbiage is taken verbatim from the game.

boardgame.name: Naufrage Atoll
boardgame.description: In the Tidalbore Isles, The Dreaded Pirates Queens, a coven of sea hags, have been collecting a series of enchanted artifacts that are scattered across this Feywild Domain. The Pirate Queens’ motives are unknown, but whatever they are, it can't be good. The good fey of the realm have been working with brave adventurers to obtain these artifacts before the hags can get their hands on them. The adventure begins after the party has successfully obtained one of these artifacts and are sailing home. However the Pirate Queens and their minions will not allow the return voyage to be safe and easy.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: A Fey King's Ransom
boardgame.description: The adventurers find themselves in the feywild domain known as The Tidalbore Isles, which is good news for the residents of Feyhaven Island. The island's king has been kidnapped by the Dreaded Pirate Queens! His subjects are in need of brave adventurers to traverse the dangerous seas to deliver the ransom to the pirates, and ensure the safe return of their beloved king.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Crossings of Fate
boardgame.description:
A 4-Hour adventure set in the creator’s Feywild domain, playable by D&D Adventurers League Forgotten Realms characters levels 5-10.

The planar distortions in Andelein are reaching its zenith! Dare you venture beyond the Feywild’s borders to confront the source? The final part, and thrilling conclusion, to the Thin Veil Trilogy.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Solitude of Solace
boardgame.description:
A little girl, seeking a cure for her dying mother, is lost. Your mission: find her and bring her home… but can you? Can you face the horror that awaits you in the depths of despair?

A 4-Hour Psychological Horror Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Rookery: City of the Dead
boardgame.description:
News of a metropolis to the west spawns a mission to investigate. The last known reports of the city are from a sailing crew that has been missing for 75 years.

The Rookery is a magical tome containing a feywild demiplane dedicated to the preservation and rehabilitation of endangered species. The land inside consists of several islands containing
diverse habitats such that any creature needing care had terrain similar to home. Once the species recovered or flourished, they were reintroduced to their native plane.

Unfortunately, before the domain truly flourished, the book along with an entire Fey queen’s library was banned and then lost. It was ultimately forgotten, and the land within it left to its own devices for many hundreds of years. As time passed, the original monitoring facilities became a forgotten ruin on a distant island.

The domain has recently been reclaimed and a new caretaker is rebuilding the operation. Now he needs a crew to sail to a nearby landmass and investigate the inhabitants of the land.

The party will sail the sea, help locals, discover a calamity, fight monsters, and find magical rewards, all while uncovering the history of the city.

This is designed as APL 4, but contains adjustment information to run at any level within Tier 1.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Impelled Reflections
boardgame.description:
Four-Hour Season 11 Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

The Archfey of Marocaro, Nite Lemos have summoned you to a personal audience. This is a great
honor and you are to travel to The Tree near Oar's Rest to meet with his minion Gly Jever.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Tale As Old As Time
boardgame.description: Grab your sword, grab your bow, pray to Torm and here we go! Enter the domain of Chief's Castle and confront its archfey, the eponymous Chief, to rescue a kidnapped woman in this homage to a classic fairy tale. This is a four hour Adventurers League legal module, optimized for five level 3 characters. It includes gridless battlemaps for use on the VTT of your choice.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Adventures in Amberhall: To Poison the King
boardgame.description:
A one-shot adventure for 1st level characters.
Working to make your living in the city of Amberhall you find yourself enmeshed in a plot to poison King Emrys. Can you find the culprits behind the plot before its too late?

This adventure is the first episode in Season One of the Arcane Vault Assembly One-Shot Series: Adventures in Amberhall.

One-shot adventures in this series can be played as stand-alone games or as a series of episodic adventures.

boardgame.name: Masquerade Murder Mystery
Murder at the Underdark Masquerade
boardgame.description:
Murder! Not the most uncommon thing in the underdark, but this one the characters have been brought in to solve before it's even taken place. And several demonic cults seem to be involved!

This is a mystery in the style of MURDLE by G. T. Karber (go check it out if you haven't!) meaning it's a puzzle which can be solved with nothing but old fashioned logical deduction. This one has a healthy serving of roleplaying opportunities and atmosphere on top.

Written for level 6, but can easily be adjusted since the mystery itself is appropriate for any level.

I especially recommend it for anyone trying to introduce a bunch of demon prince lore to their campaign in a fun way. Nothing helps players retain information like making it integral to an engaging logic puzzle.

boardgame.name: Peccary-Hollow
boardgame.description:
In a remote farming village, something has been attacking the livestock. With no othe evidence, the villagers look to the one farmer whose livestock has been spared so far. Can the adventures uncover the truth and put an end to the attacks before someone gets hurt?

Peccary-Hollow is a one-page encounter for adventures level 4-6 for the 5th edition of the world’s best known roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk Slice
boardgame.description:
The future isn’t what it used to be.

Cyberpunk has been one of the most popular genres across multiple media for nearly 40 years. Nuclear war anxiety has transformed into a grim awareness of a collapsing global ecology, carbon fiber has replaced steel in new machines, and cyberpunk has changed too, forging new futures out of rising digital culture and scientific advancements that challenge our very sense of self. The Modern AGE Cyberpunk Slice gives Modern AGE Game Masters the power to code their own cyberpunk-genre settings, inspired by the cutting edge, 80s nostalgia, and everything in between.


- drivethurrpg

boardgame.name: The Creatures of Thulê I
boardgame.description: The purpose of these booklets is to of course give you illustrations of all the strange (and some of the ordinary) creatures in MYFAROG, but also to enable the Myth Master to run a game more easily. Instead of having to take notes or flip back and forth in the core rule book every time an encounter occurs, he can now have the creature stats easily available in separate booklets!

boardgame.name: The Creatures of Thulê II
boardgame.description: The purpose of these booklets is to of course give you illustrations of all the strange (and some of the ordinary) creatures in MYFAROG, but also to enable the Myth Master to run a game more easily. Instead of having to take notes or flip back and forth in the core rule book every time an encounter occurs, he can now have the creature stats easily available in separate booklets!

boardgame.name: Homebrew Vol. 1 - For Mythic Fantasy RPG
boardgame.description:
From the very beginning of the Tabletop Roleplaying Games hobby Dungeon Masters (DMs), as they were called then, have altered, changed, tweaked, added to or removed various aspects of the game mechanics of the “rules as written”. This is known as homebrewed rules, and it is not only common but beneficial for the hobby as a whole. Homebrewing rules occur when the DM finds that the rules as written are not working as he or she desires at the gaming table.

In the next few pages you will find a number of changes I have made to the MYFAROG RPG system that I have found makes the game a bit more streamlined (fewer dice rolls), or adds new systems, classes, talents, skills or creatures (ie. pets) to enhance game play and remain a good fit within the lore of Thule.

boardgame.name: Santa Maria: GeekUp Bag Set
boardgame.description: From the BGG Store listing: "A set of five drawstring bags to store and draw the tiles from Santa Maria. These are sublimation printed microfiber bags, with the bags measuring 16 cm deep by 13 cm wide."

boardgame.name: Nexum Galaxy: Beyond
boardgame.description:
«…With time and the Atavians’ forced collaboration, they learned to better exploit the Planets by installing powerful Proton Cannons and Orbital Bases to work as shipyard-shuttles. They also discovered the special riches in some Moons, and they established a commercial network by building Enclaves linked to the Stars…»

There are three types of special structures in the expansion: the Proton Cannon, the Commercial Enclave and the Orbital Base. Each player can only build one of them per turn, as long as there are tokens available and during any phase of their turn. They can be captured along planets (or stars in the case of Commercial Enclaves)

boardgame.name: The Fen of the Five-Fold Maw Chase Cards
boardgame.description:
These Chase and Encounter cards are for use with The Fen of the Five-Fold Maw Pathfinder-compatible adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fifth Edition Options: Condition Cards
boardgame.description:
Fifth Edition Options: Condition Cards are a GM and player resource for the Dungeons & Dragons ™ 5th edition game.

In this 52 card deck you'll receive four cards of every official condition from the 5E OGL along with four cards of each of our additional conditions from Fifth Edition Options. The cards are also designed to maximize playability, so that the conditions on the face of any card are very unlikely to be used with the conditions on the rear, maximizing usability.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Idolator: A New Hybrid Class
boardgame.description:
Worship takes many forms. For some who live by faith, a temple, shrine, or other religious symbol may prove unsatisfactory for expressing their devotion. Instead, such worshipers demand a physical representation of their deity to receive prayers and adoration. Idolatry is the worship of idols, statues that represent gods and other divine forces. Idolators are pious individuals who perfect this worship, thereby forging a magical bond that animates the idol. This enables a divine aspect of the deity or outsider to walk the mortal world and perform miraculous works for the idolator on behalf of a faithful community or society.

The idolator class is a hybrid class for the Pathfinder RPG that encompasses cleric, oracle and summoner classes, yet melds them into something altogether different.

This sourcebook comes complete with a new class and abilities, archetypes, favored class options, magic items and the complete stats for the iconic idolator on the cover.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Enhanced Season 1 Hero Sheets
boardgame.description:
This is a pack of 14 thick cardboard Hero Sheets for all heroes that were available during the Sword & Sorcery Immortal Souls Kickstarter Campaign (a.k.a. season one). These replace the thin card Hero Sheets that come with the 5 heroes from the base Sword & Sorcery: Immortal Souls game, the 8 heroes that come in their own individual Hero Packs, and the Kickstarter-exclusive Hero Tristan: Standard Bearer/Warlord. Backers of that campaign received these as a stretch goal.

These were offered as an add-on in the pledge manager for the Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter campaign (a.k.a. season two), which already included Enhanced Hero Sheets for all season two heroes, allowing those with retail versions of the "Season 1" items to have the enhanced sheets. Ares Games notes that these add-on enhances sheets have 1 armor printed on them like the "Season 2" heroes, so that these original heroes are ready for play in Ancient Chronicles out of the gate without needing to add armor cards to them.

boardgame.name: Newton: Sun Set Promo
boardgame.description:
6 Sun Set action cards, that have more focus on the Voyage action.

This Newton add-on provides 6 new Action cards (+1 rule card). Each player starts with one of these cards (they are assigned through a draft during setup): these are all travel actions, linked to a specific city on the map. Whoever plays such chards gets a very interesting power, but only if have visited the showed city (so providing a mid-term game objective).

boardgame.name: Newton: New Horizon expansion
boardgame.description:
Replace the track board from the base game with this new one that provides to you more points from these tracks.

Triangular spaces:
As long as you have 1 (or more) Student on this space, you receive 1 VP every time you perform the indicated action. You receive 1 VP if you perform it as a Basic Action and/or as a Special Effect from an action card and/or as an effect from an Invention tile or a Master card. The bonus is always I VP even if you have more Students on the same space and even if the action's value is more than 1.

Objective spaces x2:
Two Objective spaces on the board show a x2 symbol and require 5 Volumes. If you have a Student here at the end of the game, you will receive double the VP provided by that Objective tile (so, if the tile shows a "max. X" limitation, also that limitation is doubled).

boardgame.name: Wattignies 1793
boardgame.description:
La bataille de Wattignies (AKA Wattignies 1793) covers the battle fought on 24 et 25 Vendémiaire an II (15th and 16th octobre 1793) between the french "armée du Nord" under the command of general Jourdan and an austrian army under the command of the prince of Coburg. It is one of the main victories of the french army during the wars of the french Revolution.

La bataille de Wattignies is the sixth game of the series "les soldats de la République" and is edited by VaeVictis.

The game includes an A2 map and 216 counters and markers.

3 scenarios are provided for this battle : the historical two-day battle, the battle without historical constraints and a shorter scenario covering only the second day.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Les Soldats de la République (Vae Victis)

boardgame.name: Starfinder Flip-Mat: Drift Crisis
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

A Trip into Trouble!

The hyperpace plane of the Drift is malfunctioning, slowing interstellar trade and travel for all spacefaring citizens of the galaxy! This jumbo, double-sided Starfinder Flip-Mat features a hex grid map of a typical expanse of the Drift on one side, perfect for the Starfinder Roleplaying Game's stsrship combat system. The other side is a standard 1-inch-square grid showing the interior of a technological structure - such as a Drift beacon, the satellites that hemp make Drift travel possible, or a high temple to Triune, the tripartite deity who resides in the Drift. Starfinder Flip-Mats present ready to use science-fantasy set pieces for the buy Game Master. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Drift Crisis, you'll be ready for this setting-changing catastrophe!

boardgame.name: アトラスの後釜 (Atlas Junior)
boardgame.description:
アトラスの後釜 (Atlas Junior) is a card game from Japan.

The publisher says:
Atlas, the giant that has sustained the world since mythical times, is no match for age.
The time has come to hand over the role to his successor. You are the young ace giants who have put up their hands as candidates for his successor.
The next Atlas is the one who has supported the world as it is gradually passed from one Atlas to the next, standing in his place until the end.
Now, who will show the most outstanding strength?

神話の代から世界を支え続けた巨人アトラスも年には勝てません。
役目を後任にたくす時が来ました。あなたたちは後任候補に手を挙げた若きエース巨人です。
アトラスから徐々に渡される世界を代わりばんこで支え、最後まで立っていた者が次のアトラスです。
さて、最もすぐれた力を示すのは誰でしょうか？
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Plutocracy
boardgame.description:
Space is Time is Money is Power:
In Plutocracy, 2 to 4 players lead each one of the big trading corporations and will travel from planet to planet to buy and sell resources. By selling at a higher price than buying, players will earn money (Space Euros S€).
They need S€ to buy seats in the planetary parliaments.
In each of the 3 elections during the game, players that have a majority in a planetary parliament will send Councilors to the Plutocratic Council.
Equally important as the elections are the Societies on Earth: players that meet the conditions to join them while on Earth may also send Councilors to the Plutocratic Council.
The ultimate objective of each player is to have the most Councilors in the Plutocratic Council at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Tick Tack Bumm Pocket
boardgame.description:
As with the other editions of Tick Tack Bumm (aka Pass the bomb), speed is the most important factor in the pocket version. Here, however, no bomb goes from hand to hand, but everyone always plays at the same time! The bomb at Tick Tack Bumm Pocket can be found on some of the cards to be turned on: In this category it is important to find a word as quickly as possible that contains the letter combination you are looking for. Poetry fans have the advantage of looking for a suitable rhyme word. And with the magnifying glass symbol, a word that matches the respective category is required. If you play fast-paced and with brains, you quickly get closer to the goal of first discarding all cards and thus winning the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Barrage: Executive Officer Promo D
boardgame.description: When you perform a production action and fulfill a Contract with a lower value than the energy produced, move your marker on the Energy Track only by the exceeding value. During the End of Round Phase, move your marker back on the Energy Track to the lower limit of the current round section (onlv if vou have reached it). Otherwise, don't move your marker back.

boardgame.name: Dark Matter: A Game of Strategy and Survival
boardgame.description:
Dark Matter is a competitive sci-fi strategy board game for three to six players. Players will use strategy and diplomacy to earn victory points through expanding your empire with StarBase construction, researching dark matter that will populate in the center of the board through the game, through diplomacy with your rival players, construction and protection of your flagship, and by completing objectives. Offers board and event randomization so that no two games are the same.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: In The Company of Doppelgangers
boardgame.description:
Who will you be next?
Come experience the wonder and mystique of the doppelganger, able to impersonate and emulate virtually any other character!

Create the doppelganger you want to play in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, growing in power until you can become the perfect double of your mark.

Written by Joshua Hennington, this supplement includes:

-The immicker race of shapeshifters

-Alternate racial traits and favored class options

-New class archetypes: the Mental Grifter(Psychic), Mophic Petitioner (Cleric), Versatile Armsmaster (Fighter), and Natural Mimic (Druid)

-Doppelganger racial paragon class 1st -20th level, plus a variant multiclass to combine the paragon with any other class

-Class and race specific feats to round out any doppelganger character

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: BANKS
boardgame.description:
In the year 2511 in a society run through Augmented Reality; omnipotent corporations have replaced each continent. A fast paced, cutting edge game known as BANKS is the neo-gladiator approved sport on Earth, with teams embodying each of their corporate spheres. As players you fight for your sphere's personal freedoms and to gain corporate favor.

In BANKS you face up to five various opponents. With the disks distributed over the light rails, your goal at the end of the game is the product of the number of disks in each captured color. Highest score wins, AMASS!

On your turn, move one of your disks in a straight line over any number of open spaces, possibly banking off edges or corners of the board, (like pool). You may stop at any point after moving at least one space.

If, after banking off at least one edge, your disk lands on a space occupied by any other disk (even one of your own disks), capture that disk by replacement. At the end of the game, your score is the number of disks in each captured color multiplied.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heading Forward
boardgame.description:
A car crash. A sports injury. A workplace accident. Any one of these could have brought you where you are today – a traumatic brain injury. But Heading Forward isn't about how you got here. It's about what happens next.

In this unusual solitaire game, you will take on the role of someone going through rehabilitation. To win, you must relearn and develop skills, achieving goals in at least three different areas in the time you've been allotted by your insurance company. Fail to do so, and they will discontinue payment, resulting in your loss.

Skills are developed by rotating and switching out cards, upgrading in sequence from weak Level 1 skills to powerful Level 4 skills. To do so, you'll need to carefully manage your emotional and physical energy ("spoons") as well as other resources. But lurking in the deck is the memory of your trauma – the trigger card. It's a hard road ahead of you – even the simplest things feel so impossible at first. But as you stubbornly push forward, you'll slowly regain the skills you'll need to take on the bigger challenges ahead of you.

Based on designer John du Bois's own recovery, Heading Forward is a stunning and expressive example of what board games can do and can be.

—description from the publihser
