boardgame.name: ほしあわせ (Star Memory)
boardgame.description:
ほしあわせ (Star Memory) is a card game from Japan. The cards show highly detailed photographs of constellations. The constellations are from the 12 zodiac signs.

The deck has 36 cards. 12 are reference cards, naming the constellation and giving a description (in Japanese). The remaining 24 cards are pairs of photographs, mostly being massed starfields with a few bright spots.

The game can be played three ways:

ほしあわせ (Hoshi awase) - a memo game, the 24 starfields are shuffled and dealt face-down. Players take turns turning cards up to make pairs.

ほしかるた (Hoshi karuta) - the description cards are read out, and players try to pick the correct starfield card from 12 face-up.

みつぼしあわせ (Mitsu bo shiawase) - a memo game using all three cards.

黄道十二星座の美しい写真で作られたカードで遊ぶ、星座カードゲーム。

全写真カードを裏向きにして神経衰弱として遊ぶ「ほしあわせ」、各星座の写真カード1枚ずつを表向きにして読み手が読み上げた星座を探す「ほしかるた」、説明カードも含めて各星座3枚ずつを使って神経衰弱として遊ぶ「みつぼしあわせ」の3種類の遊び方があります。
user summary

boardgame.name: Happy Little Trees
boardgame.description: In Happy Little Trees your goal is to be the first player to discard your personal deck of cards by matching and planting trees according to color and shape.

boardgame.name: Cowbell
boardgame.description:
Cowbell is meant to be a gentler introduction to many of the contracts played in the more elaborate, traditional card game, Vira. Most of the same contracts remain (presented in a different form) but some contracts have been added (to make the game a little easier for those just starting out) and some have been removed (for the same reason).

Cowbell is as much about risk-taking as it is about trick-taking.

So, be bold: try to ring the Bell of Fame! and never earn the Cow of Shame...
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Score Book
boardgame.description: 24 page book for recording game session results. This item was offered as a non-exclusive add-on during the 2017 D-Day Dice Kickstarter campaign (listed as a solo play score book, but the physical item received does NOT limit its use to solo play only).

boardgame.name: Characters Welcome: A Game of Beach Mysteries
boardgame.description:
Airing Mondays at 8PM/7PM CST

This is a role-playing game for two or more players, in which you’ll create a random episode of a long-running, serialized prime-time drama, probably airing on the USA Network. It’s set on a beach, or at least, near a beach. There are mysteries to solve; ones the cops can’t (or won’t) crack. That’s where you come in. Together you’ll play the unlikely experts who just might solve this mystery, while trying to find time to soak up the sun, and keep The Man from keeping you down.

(itch.io description of the game)
boardgame.rpg: Characters Welcome: A Game of Beach Mysteries

boardgame.name: Bau Simulator 3
Bau Simulator 3: Console Edition
Construction Simulator 3
Construction Simulator 3 - Console Edition
コンストラクション シミュレーター 3
boardgame.description:
Construction Simulator 3 returns to Europe! Discover an idyllic European town in the sequel to the popular Construction Simulator 2 and Construction Simulator 2014 with officially licensed vehicles by famous brands: Caterpillar, Liebherr, CASE, Bobcat, Palfinger, STILL, MAN, ATLAS, Bell, BOMAG, WIRTGEN GmbH, JOSEPH VÖGELE AG, HAMM AG and MEILLER Kipper. Take on diverse and challenging contracts. Build and repair roads and houses. Shape the skyline of your city and expand your vehicle fleet. Explore a completely new map and unlock new contracts and vehicles with your growing company.

Features:

Sequel to the popular Construction Simulator 2 and Construction Simulator 2014
Over 50 vehicles and machines by 14 brands
Detailed cockpit view
More than 70 contracts
Including road and bridge construction, gardening and landscaping
Supports Game Center

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbox Series downloadable edition

boardgame.name: The Egyptian Enigma
boardgame.description:
Agent Cleo works for the mysterious organisation known as the Ministry of Time... and she’s trapped in Egypt in 1922! This looks like foul play... She’s sent a package through time, desperately hoping it falls into the right hands. Can you save her?

The Egyptian Enigma is an escape room challenge contained entirely in one exciting package. Search through a mysterious series of envelopes, solve the puzzles and outsmart your enemies; all before the timer runs out!

Everything is in the package; documents, clues, secrets and traps that you’ll have to navigate to save the day.
All you’ll need is a device with an internet connection, a pen and paper to make notes, and maybe some friends or family to play with!

This immersive, storytelling experience lasts around an hour. You’ll interact with characters and solve head-scratching challenges in a thrilling historical adventure that takes you all the way back to the time of the Pharaohs.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cretaceous Rails
boardgame.description:
Travel back in time to the cretaceous period, build a rail network, and take time-traveling tourists to see their favorite dinosaurs in the wild. After going on safari, tourists can relax at your resort where they can enjoy your latest and greatest attractions, including the dinosaurs you have on display.

This quick-playing mid-weight Euro utilizes a dual action worker placement system, route building, and resource management. It's a race to exploit the resources of the cretaceous jungle, and build the optimum combination of attractions for abilities and scoring. Build the most successful dino resort by the end of the fourth round to win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: はないちもんめ (Hana Ichi Monme)
boardgame.description:
はないちもんめ (Hana Ichi Monme) is a bluffing card game from Japan for 2 or 3 players. The title means something like 'flower position'.

Each player has a set of seven cards in their own colour. Some cards are Warabe (children) and some are Ayakashi (weird). If a player can give away all their weird cards by the end, they win. Otherwise, points are calculated.

Each card has a shadow half, and a bright half, on both sides of the card. So a player can look at another player's hand and see which cards are the bright side up and shadow side up. Players arrange their own hands at the start of the game, and cannot change this later.

At the start of the game, all the cards in the player's hand are shadow side up.

Players take turns to offer a card to another player, by drawing the card up a little in their hand. The player offered either takes it or declines it, but either way the card is now turned shadow side down, and cannot be offered away. If the card was taken, the player can place it anywhere they like in their hand. If declined, it stays in the same position as before and cannot be moved.

Once every hand is shadow side down, the game ends. If a player has disposed of all their own Ayakashi cards, they win. Collecting Ayakashi cards from other players does not matter.

Otherwise, players score points. +1 pt for Warabe cards, -1 or -2pts for Ayakashi cards. But if a Ayakashi cards is flanked by Warabe cards, it is worth zero. Then, the most points wins.

The rules allow for a 4 player game using two packs. In this case, it is played as a doubles game, with partners discussing their moves.
user summary

boardgame.name: Artificer's Codex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Light spread everywhere, covering the entire lab in a bright flood of luminescence. Elana squinted into the bright light as she carefully transferred her own arcane power into the opalescent stone cradled in its beveled setting. The gem dimmed back to a soft glow as it hung on the necklace. Hope filled Elana as she prayed to the gods that this artifact will be powerful enough to protect her sister from the dangers they will face on the upcoming journey.

Ages ago, the ancients had the skills and knowledge to create artifacts–magic items that stored permanent arcane energy in the form of spells and preternatural effects. As the centuries passed, the mastery of crafting such relics had been forgotten. Until now.

After generations of dangerous explorations into the ruins of lost civilizations and long, arduous research in the most sophisticated arcane labs, artificers have unlocked the ability to produce artifacts once again. Now they share this collected knowledge with you in the Artificer’s Codex.

Artificer’s Codex presents new Setting Rules and Edges that allow artificers to create permanent magic items in a high-magic, fantasy Savage Worlds setting. While designed for fantasy settings, these rules can be adapted easily to other genres as well.

boardgame.name: Poetry for Neanderthals: NSFW Edition
boardgame.description:
Poetry for Neanderthals: NSFW Edition is an adult party game similar to Taboo in which players earn points by getting their teammates to guess words and phrases. The catch is that they are allowed to use only single-syllable words. Enjoy getting grandma to guess phrases like "nudist beach", "mile high club", or "banana hammock", but be careful. If you use any words with more than one syllable, the other team gets to spank you with the two-foot inflatable Spank Stick.

But maybe that's not such a bad thing?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Of Light and Darkness
boardgame.description:
The battle between good and evil is ceaseless. It stretches as far back as the beginning of time, and continues to rage in present day. This is where you come in. It's time to pick a side. Will you be a hero, and command the forces of light? Or, are you a villain, determined to lead those who dwell in darkness? The choice is yours.

Of Light and Darkness is a 2-player game in which you get to play as either good (heroes) or evil (villains). Some cards have special abilities. Others don't. Your goal is simply to have the most of your cards on the table, and connected by sharing a side, when all cards have been used.

boardgame.name: Falling Down
boardgame.description: Falling Down is an autumn season-themed game, but it also involves the element of "gravity." During play, you endeavour to make matches between multiples of cards that contain the same imagery, to collect as many as possible. However, the animals can only be collected when they fall out of the bottom of the grid of cards on the playing surface. It's a game of matching, strategy, and turn taking.

boardgame.name: Escaping Mars
boardgame.description: In Escaping Mars, you role play as one of the last remaining citizens of Colony 7, a settlement on a post-terraformed Red Planet (which has been overrun by a ruthless gang known as The Brotherhood of Broken Skulls), in the year 3254. During play, your goal is to get past the baddies, find the "battery unit," power up the last working drone transport, fend off other citizens who have the same idea, and get out while you still can.

boardgame.name: Zòku
boardgame.description: In Zòku, you control one of four groups of characters (Preps, Jocks, Nerds, or Misfits), as you try to be the first to assemble a connected group of your peers on the school playground, and push the other cliques out. Each character card has a number that represents its "personality strength" that, during play, determines whether or not it can be used to push other characters around on the playing surface. It's a fun, quirky, adorably schoolyard-themed card game with 68 original characters!

boardgame.name: Uno: Schitt’s Creek
boardgame.description:
It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows but featuring favorite characters from Schitt's Creek. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and symbol, but every card has either a 'Love' or 'Money' icon on it. When someone plays a special 'Where Everyone Fits In' card, they call out either 'love' or 'money.' Players then reveal their hands and may have to draw cards if they don't have enough of the chosen icon. And just like always, when a player is down to one card, they must shout, 'UNO!' Makes a great gift for card game lovers and Schitt's Creek fans ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

The classic UNO card game builds fun on game night with themes inspired by Schitt's Creek.
Each game features a deck decorated with character graphics from beloved show!
As in classic UNO game, players match colors, numbers and symbols to the card on top of the discard pile!
A special 'Where Everyone Fits In' rule may force some player to draw cards.
Makes a great gift for kid, teen, adult and family game nights with 2 to 10 players ages 7 years and older!

boardgame.name: The Potions of the Anathar
boardgame.description:
From inside front cover:

This book was designed to be used by players. They should know where (and how) to obtain the ingredients listed here. Do not, however, just give away the ingredients--they are very rare. Many good adventures can be created around the search for special ingredients. Traps, dungeon entrances, old buildings, etc. can be provided for searchers to stumble into.

Be very strict with the ingredients and mixing procedures. Exact stiff penalties for mistakes in concoction. Characters will DIE if they aren't careful. Feel free to modify the potions described here or create your own similar ones. Experiment and enjoy.

Phil Martin

boardgame.name: Пруд императора
boardgame.description:
In this game you rule one fish from Emperor of Japan pond.

Each turn you move your fish (Koi) on hexagonal field, eat and collect food and upgrade your tablet.

•••

В этой игре вам предстоит взять под управление одну из рыбок кои в императорском пруду и довести её первой до вознесения дракона. Рассчитывайте свои возможности, чтобы каждый ход совершать с максимальной выгодой и не забывайте следить за игроками, чтобы вовремя помешать им вырвать победу из ваших плавников. В ходе игры вы будете перемещаться по игровому полю, собирать еду для своей рыбки и прокачивать свой планшет, чтобы каждый новых ход становился всё более эффективным.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: A Deadly Disturbance
boardgame.description:
From the description

A Deadly Disturbance is intended for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 5. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach halfway to 6th-level. Spirits have been assailing the village of Blackthorn. This campaign takes place in Arden, although it can be set in your own world. Any party composition should be able to finish the adventure with intelligent play.

boardgame.name: The Road to Swordfall
boardgame.description:
From the description

The Road to Swordfall is intended for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 2. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach 3rd-level. Travelers have begun disappearing along a well known pilgrim's road. This campaign takes place in Arden, although it can be set in your own world. Any party composition should be able to finish the adventure with intelligent play.

boardgame.name: Curse of the Blood Moon
boardgame.description:
From the description

Curse of the Blood Moon is intended for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 2. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach 3rd-level. A tribe of evil druids has summoned a Blood Moon to drive everyone mad. This campaign takes place in Arden, although it can be set in your own world. Any party composition should be able to finish the adventure with intelligent play.

boardgame.name: The Price of Power
boardgame.description:
From the description

The Price of Power is intended for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach halfway to 4th-level. A priest has made a pact with a dark entity and now it's come to claim its part of the bargain. This campaign takes place in Arden, although it can be set in your own world. Any party composition should be able to finish the adventure with intelligent play.

boardgame.name: The Feylight Festival
boardgame.description:
From the description

The Feylight Festival is intended for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 1. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach 2nd-level. It's that time of year again as the Feylands open their borders to outsiders for a series of games, shows, and whimsy. This campaign takes place in Arden, although it can be set in your own world. Any party composition should be able to finish the adventure with intelligent play.

boardgame.name: Step into the Dark Future
boardgame.description:
'Distributor Blurb'

Step into the Dark Future with Cyberpunk RED Easy Mode, a quickstart and mission that'll throw you head first onto the streets of Night City.

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: Pour une Poignée de Néo Dollars
Escape Quest: Za garść neodolarów
boardgame.description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ... Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2062. Nuclear war and economic disaster have left all power in the hands of massive corporations You are just a young, self-taught hacker making ends meet in the sprawl, until one night you receive a cryptic message from a mysterious sender: “Join us”. You are then suddenly swept into a race for your own survival, and perhaps that of all the other users on the network ! Sides become blurry; which lines will you cross ? Is the ultimate hacking code worth your life, or just a few neodollars more?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: Au delà du Virtuel
Escape Quest: Świat Wirtualny
boardgame.description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ...

Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2101. ASTRAL, the largest VR online gaming platform in the world is run by Demosthenes, a true AI, and something went terribly wrong. Millions of users suddenly dropped into a virtual coma, and nobody knows why. It falls on you to understand what happened and save the countless lives at stake. Confront the virtual worlds designed by the AI, for their many deadly challenges hold the key to solving this not-so-virtual mystery !

boardgame.name: Hnefatafl: The Viking Tales
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in the world of new boardgame Hnefetafl: The Viking Tales and lead your troops to victory in a strategic game for up to four players! Play as a various characters from the Viking history and mythology while competing with your friends in various scenarios.

The game of Hnefatafl, often translated as "Kings' Table" began its life in Scandinavia over 1600 years ago. In the traditional version, one player is a king with troops who are caught in an ambush by the forces of the second player.

Hnefetafl: The Viking Tales has been expanded to include a 4-player version, while preserving simple rules that guarantee long hours of fun with countless gameplay possibilities. Each game includes a variety of scenarios with multiple goals to achieve. The stories are presented as Sagas in which you will play as famous Vikings and Gods from Scandinavian mythology.

boardgame.name: Legacy Bestiary
boardgame.description:
ehold the Legacy!
Starfarer Adversaries: Legacy Bestiary is a collection of more than 200 classic fantasy monsters, updated for a science-fantasy universe! The Starfinder Roleplaying Game presents a galaxy with the same history and cosmology as the sword-and-sorcery “Fantasy Path” RPG that came before it, but has little room to update what the monsters of that fantasy world have done with access to star-travel! This tome not only updates these “Legacy” creatures to the Starfinder Roleplaying Game rules, it updates their concepts to account for high-tech and galactic adventure.

Mimics as vending machines! Uplifted owlbears! Frost giants wielding cryoweapons! Dinosaur-themed warbots! But it also presents new options that build on those fantasy concept. Mimic starfighters. Undead dinosaurs. Void elementals. Mecha-Tiamat!

So whether you are looking forward to hurling updated fantasy versions of legacy standbys from older versions of the game, want to see what new creations can evolve when scifi and fantasy concepts mix, or just need more adversaries at a range of CRs to pit against your PCs, the Legacy bestiary has what you need!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Ahau: Eclipse
boardgame.description:
The first official expansion of Ahau: Rulers of Yucatáns adds 14 Eclipse cards, 6 additional role cards, 5 building tiles and 10 special pyramid tiles, to enhance your Ahau experience. The Eclipse event cards provide more opportunities and challenges for scoring, resource conversion, summoning, and strategic gameplay in each round.

Eclipse introduces us to the history-shaping, cataclysmic and mythical events of the Classic Period.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pyramid of the Undying
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A new take on the greatest D&D adventure ever written.

Tom Moldvay’s “The Lost City” is without a doubt my favourite of the early D&D modules. There’s so much fun to be had with the weird Cynidiceans, the faction play, and the mystery of what’s happening in the pyramid. I’ve run this adventure top-to-bottom probably three or four times, over dozens of sessions. I’ve gathered what I learned from that into this “fan edit” dungeon, which I hope allows more people to appreciate what I love about the Lost City.

boardgame.name: Lizards and Lies
boardgame.description:
Do you want to sow conspiracy or stop it in its tracks? Lizards and Lies is a 2v2 (or 1v1) battler that lets you play with the push and pull of conspiracy theory moving through social media. Play as one of four characters and use unique abilities and cards to influence the network. Platform Moderators and Educators face off against Edgelords and Conspiracy theorists in this asymmetrical board brawler. Will you convince the world that lizards are taking over, or that birds are surveilling society? Or will you shut down these lies?

Lizards and Lies is designed as a serious game meant to reflect the movement of disinformed content (like conspiracy) through social media.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Le Mura di Alesia
boardgame.description:
52 BC. The Gallic tribes led by Vercingetorix were defeated by the army of Gaius Julius Caesar near Dijon and retreat to the city of Alesia, convinced to find in this fortress a safe position and the time necessary to regroup the troops and recover morale.

Julius Caesar, sensing the intentions of the enemy, also takes advantage of the particular isolated position of the city, planning one of the most ingenious sieges in history. He built two rings of fortifications, one external and one internal, to defend himself at the same time from attacks from the city and from the tribes who came to the aid of the besieged. The walls were fortified with towers, ditches and traps and sanctioned the victory of the Romans over the Gauls.

In The Walls of Alesia each of the two players takes the role of a Roman Legatus, commissioned by Caesar to supervise the construction of one of the two walls. Each one will have to take care of creating the most effective fortifications, hiring the necessary workers and deciding for each stretch whether to obtain immediate advantages from the palisades or to erect towers that will guarantee future advantages.

There will be a high competition in this constructors' challenge, but during the match there will also be two coordinated assaults by the Gauls, in which the Legates will have to cooperate to limit the damage. At the end of the second assault, it will be verified who has obtained the most prestige in the eyes of Julius Caesar.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bloxorz
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Bloxorzs is a puzzle game where the player controls a rectangular block, manipulating it via rotation on the long and short sides to avoid obstacles and make it through the level to the square exit hole. As the game advances, it introduces various mechanics, such as splitting the block or falling floor tiles that can only be moved over if the block is on its side. There are 33 levels of increasing difficulty to beat.

boardgame.name: TOKKA Race
boardgame.description:
TOKKA Race is a dexterity game where wooden pieces are used to construct the boundaries of a race track. The players use finger-flicks to send small pucks around the track, a la Carrom.
During the race players can unlock one-use special abilities, e.g. when another puck is moved outside the game boundaries, which give them an extra move or allows them to try to flick another player outside of the game boundaries.
The race lasts five rounds and whoever crosses the finish line first is the winner.

boardgame.name: DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom
boardgame.description:
DICE PARK: Dungeons of Doom is a roll&write for 1 to 100 players ages 8 and up.

During 30-45 minutes games, players will have to use their dice to create the most frightening dungeon.

Roll your dice (5 in total) and use them to create a path in your Dungeon, place creatures and score the most points to become THE Dungeon Master!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Exo-Terra
boardgame.description:
Exo-Terra is a 2-4 player tactical scifi themed game where players command giant robots in combat against a nefarious enemy in a far away future on plants outside of our solar system.
Players will command giant robots, known as Exo-Jackets, as they progress through a campaign - completing missions, unwrapping the mystery of the story, and customizing every aspect of their mechanic arsenal.
Leveraging a new system of enemy generation, battles should always feel different, even if facing the same enemy units. This is accomplished through several factors of enemy customization that force players to assess each situation individually, instead of relying on old experience on how to approach a battle.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cook King
boardgame.description:
Cook King is a party mode card game for dish making and kitchen expansion.

Combine ingredients to create different recipes and prevent other players from preparing dishes by throwing attack cards at them, and thereby taking points away.

Sell your dishes and buy more kitchen equipment to acquire new skills and win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Décorum: Acrylic Token Upgrade
boardgame.description: 60+ Acrylic tokens to replace the object and paint tokens from the retail version of Décorum - A game of passive aggressive cohabitation.

boardgame.name: There Be Gnolls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This module was designed for friends to be enjoyed at a small table at a local brewery. This module was written for two, 3rd level, characters and keeps a fairly linear layout to ensure it can be completed in one sitting.


Welcome to the northern Kingdom of Fallowhood. Home to dark forests, deep mines, colorful creatures, dazzling lakes and a flourishing death cult. This lakeside town now hides in their homes to avoid roaming hyena packs and the dreadful cultist cries to avoid being counted as missing.

After the disappearance of the crown prince, the King sent forth a summons throughout the southern kingdoms that Fallowhood would pay 500 gp to any hero that aided with the cult’s eradication. The hero must bring proof of this task, of course.

The King’s summons brought you to Fallowhood. You decided to start with the locals at “The Scattered Dragon” Tavern. Most frequently repeated are the unusual tracks heading northward through the Willows and the temple of no name…

User summary:

The PDF scenario is distributed with three PNG map files.

boardgame.name: Random Pantheon Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking to create a pantheon of gods for your campaign world? Or add new gods to an existing campaign? This product helps guide you through the creation of new gods, how they might fit in the pantheon, and re-contextualizes some of what it means to adventure in a polytheistic setting. Also included are powers and bonuses that Clerics from the DCC RPG game could receive from gods generated in this book.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Deadly Games
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'Deadly Games' is a quick-adventure for a party of four 3rd level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
Cities are places where even the darkest beings can hide in plain sight. Dangerous Games is an excellent 1st adventure for a party starting at 3rd level, or as a stand alone adventure during that time. Vampires can be replaced by bored nobles, or perhaps even experimental wizards. Either way, the party is kidnapped from their normal lives and brought together in 'The Trial'. Other potential names include: Gauntlet, Crucible, Baptism, Ordeal.

The goal is simple. A fanged magic mouth spell, bloody letter, or perhaps some kind of black mirror is what the party first encounters. They are given a simple deal.

“Your capture, dear cattle, forgive. Five trials and you can live. Our words, though fanged, are true. Fail, and we will feast on you!”

The players, fully rested, have their equipment and are not harassed out of the room until the group has spells prepared and are otherwise ready.

boardgame.name: Feral Garden
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'Feral Garden' is a quick-adventure for a party of four 6th level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background

Adventurers are often travelers. This particular forest road sees the party getting ready to reach a small farming community. Arriving late in the evening the entire community is surrounded by a palisade, with the farms outside of the gate. Seemingly hastily made, the palisade is locked tight with a pair of torches lighting the area.
The party will encounter a trio of deadly wolves that ambush them at the gate. These are wolves who have been cursed with vampirism, and the purpose of the gate it made clear. They are unable to cross over, but viciously attack the party outside of the gate.

boardgame.name: It Takes a Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'It Takes a Village' is a quick-adventure for a party of four 8th level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background

A small village in a rural area provides a party of traveling adventurers a site of respite. Everything appears completely normal. The public house provides the party with a room for the night, and a wonderful meal. Everything seems idyllic and safe. After a dangerous set of adventures the party will be very pleased with the chance for some rest.

Unfortunately now the party has placed themselves in the middle of what will be a very dangerous evening. Thirty years ago another adventurer came to this village and settled down. His death left his home open, and his son settled within. What no one knows is that the former adventurer had a strange artifact called the 'Necromancer's Tablet'.

After awakening during the assault the party must fight their way out of the public, and can choose to help save others while eventually finding the necromancer, defeating them, and saving what remains of the village.

The name, and culture of the village is specifically left vague in order to allow GM's to design their own or adapt it to existing settings.

boardgame.name: Garden of Discontent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party is tasked with picking up an item from a nearby herbologist. Easy task and decent pay until the party realize the herbologist is gone and has left the package out in his colorful garden. While pretty, there are some dangers the party wasn't expecting!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for four, mid (3rd) level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Monster Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These are 1/4 page cut out cards tat can be printed in a home computer. They each depict monsters from Fanged Fables.

boardgame.name: Orc Blood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'Orc Blood' is a quick-adventure for a party of four 13th level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Monsters in Bold can be referenced in the SRD or in the core rule books.

Adventure Background

The Mountains hold great secrets, and these mountains are no different. Deep within the holler a cave entrance has a large tree growing over the entrance. The orcs living here are pretty far from human towns or other civilized lands.

A single, injured, and fleeing vampire stumbled upon the cave weeks earlier. The orcs fell him quickly when he attacked their tribe. However, none knew the actual danger they faced when one of their dead rose back to life. The orcs believed it merely a sign of the strength of that orc, a blessing of their faith. They were terribly wrong.

Two more rose as well. So began the terrible feast. They fed upon male, female, and down to the chief itself spreading this vile taint in every fell orc. It took a week for the last orc to fall. Deep underground it was easy for the vampires to maintain their siege, and difficult for the living orcs to get rest.

Now, starving, the vampire orcs have begun to roam the forest. Hunters noticed it first. Dead animals drained of blood and torn apart. Then travelers. Either way the party has been asked to go and put an end to these marauding orcs. The real question is, do they know the orcs are vampiric, or will that be a surprise to the party?

boardgame.name: The Abbey
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'The Abbey' is a quick-adventure for a party of four 11thth level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background

Old country roads can lead strange places. Weary from travel, a group of adventurers come to a strange large and seemingly abandoned abbey deep in the forest. In the twilight hours the old ruined buildings, crumbling and well overgrown foundations hide a still inhabited and sizable building. A flash of lightning signals a coming thunderstorm. Upon knocking the party is met with the face of a young and pale holy woman in the vestments of a nun of some type.

The nun explains that the abbey is a holy sanctuary, and that generally only those who dedicate their lives to their faith are allowed entry. She seems hesitant, but if the party makes any request for shelter out of the approaching thunderstorm she requests a moment, and returns shortly later allowing the party entry. Inside of the abbey it is dark, as the building has few windows. By the light of a candelabra she leads the party into the abbey. She tells the party that they are preparing for a special ritual tonight in the chapel, and for them not to wander out of their room until morning. When asked, she simply states that this ritual is a private one and interruptions can't be allowed. She bids them goodnight, allows them two to a dorm room, and locks the door behind her as she leaves.

boardgame.name: The Devil's Pass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Very bad men in very deep trouble"

Travel back in time to 1452, to find a gang of hardened mercenaries gone very, very bad. They have taken up residence in a hidden valley in the Franconian forest, where their sins have caught up with them at last. But their innocent neighbors are suffering too. War has broken out and blocked your route, putting this tortured valley in your path. Can you penetrate the deadly mystery, and liberate the people of The Devil’s Pass?

Codex Adventum: The Devil’s Pass is a short historical 'Low Magic' adventure with strong horror elements. It is designed for 3-4 players of levels 4-6. This mini-module is based in the same world as The Road To Monsterberg series, in a slightly different region (600 km away) in Franconia, Germany. But it's basically the same Late Medieval Holy Roman Emprie. This module is designed for you to hit the ground running, with less preparation and more convenience. It comes with five pre-gen characters and several NPCs (several of which can also be used as player characters) although you can generate your own using the Player's Guide or any other method you prefer. It's also adaptable to other systems such as WHFRP, Mythras, Gurps Low Tech etc.
This module takes place where the mini-encounter "Robbery at the Zur Höll" leaves off, and that entire micro-encounter is also included in this book for conveniencce. The Devil's Pass puts your players into a contained environment, a seven kilometer long valley, where a small town is bseieged by the depraved remnants of a mercenary company gone bad. There are other (supernatural) things afoot in the valley to further complicate the situation, and your PCs will have to be on their toes to survive. They will have an opportunity to engage in several combat encounters and (if you want) to unravel a variety of mysteries.

boardgame.name: Alpha
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

‘Alpha’ is a quick-adventure for a party of four 5th level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
While traveling in the dark for- ests at night the party decides to camp. They never even suspect the full moon as a dark omen of the horrors to come. A werewolf pack lives near these woods. The full moon is out and the pack is looking for a hunt tonight. Where normally they would target bears, or other dangerous monsters, tonight the adventurers prove a delicious distraction. This is less of a traveling adventure, and more of a survival one. The players are ambushed, and as they try to either hunt down or run away, they are hounded by werewolves.

boardgame.name: Cult of the Rainbow Serpent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

‘Cult of the Rainbow Serpent’ is a quick-adventure for a party of four 4th level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
Deep in the jungles a strange cult centered around a heavenly figure has been kidnapping, raiding, and doing whatever necessary to collect mortal sacrifices to appease this strange being whom they are calling ‘The Rainbow Serpent’. In truth it is a Coautl, normally a heavenly, law- ful good being. This one has become twisted and evil yet maintains its magical powers. It now wishes to feed upon humanoids, and grants its spells of cure wounds, create food and water, an its restoration spells as blessings to the cultists that serve it.

boardgame.name: Deadly Nightshade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

‘Deadly Nightshade’ is a quick-ad- venture for a party of four 3rd level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
Lying in bed is a young man approaching his eighteenth birthday. He is unconscious, and his family says he was the victim of a witch. He is trapped in a nightmare. The family beseeches the party to hunt down the witch and kill her to free their son from this terrible curse.

boardgame.name: Skeletons in the Closet
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

‘Skeletons in the Closet’ is a quick-adventure for a party of four 1st level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
A noble is the last son of a family that has met an unfortunate end. After receiving word that he had inherited the ancestral home the displaced noble returns with plans to restore his family estate and sell it, and return from where he came. All was well until workers began to complain that there was something amiss in the home. Strange noises and the like. Especially coming from one place in the home. Renovations of the area revealed a sealed set of stairs that descended deep into an abandoned tomb. Disturbed by the strange sounds and possibly haunting, this noble has sent word he needs stout and capable people to open the tomb, clear any dangerous evils or curses, and make it safe to explore and stop the strange haunting noises in the house.

boardgame.name: Ghoul Nest Dressing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the ghoul nests in your campaign.
